data.author: cedbin
data.content: Remember the negative messages are all from people we've never heard about before.. They didn't even know the existence of the company a week ago. They just appeared because of the run and they have no idea what they are talking about. The company always was VERY conservative with the money. For example, they don't even pay for the assays in their drilling in Ireland because they use the University to get the analysis for free (it takes longer though but who cares). MVI erased all the company's debt recently and converted it to equity (which was the sign the stock was going to be off the races). I bought all my shares between 0.5 and 0.7 and haven't sold once.

data.author: cedbin
data.content: You are both wrong about the potential numbers, let me do some quick math : Current gold price : 5000 usd/oz and it will continue to goes up in the near future thanks to the de-dollarization around the world + the negative real interest rates (inflation being obviously way higher than reported in the western world). Now for the Karaberd mine : The future processing plant will be able to process 100 000t/year. 30 000t/year are allowed to be extracted underground at an average grade of 4.7g/t So that's 70 000y/year left at open pit at an average grade of 1g/t 30000*4.7+70000*1 = 211 kg of gold/year 211kg is 7450 oz 7450 oz * 5000 usd = 37M of gross profits I'm not even counting the silver BTW, i'll let you do the math.. So even if we consider a conservative net profit of 20M/year (half of the gross and not even counting the silver), and a conservative PE of 5, that's still a 100M mcap company... And again, i'm not even counting the other assets... For those who can't understand why the parabolic move happened so fast, well because the marketcap was absolutely ridiculous, like literally a mcap of a near bankrupt company even though in reality, it's only the beginning of a future cash cow. Remember that MVI (the main shareholder which executed the RTO of the company) has bonuses in the contract (free shares) if the company reach  100Mcap for like 60 days, and again another bonus if IMC reaches a mcap of 200M for 60days + So you can bet they perfectly knows what they own.. The company is also owned at 90%+ by insiders! Even during the 2023 run, no insiders ever sold, and the CEO even bought the top.. That's why the liquidity is so thin and the upside movement so explosive, because the free float is tiny.

data.content: Yes but IMHO. Other investors may or may not share this view. The Avoca spoils (on current metal prices) were reported to be worth £71,346,400 (RNS'd) against the current Mcap of just £6.5m but it is the Wexford project that I am most interested in given the previous bonanza gold grade but also the recent reported gold grades. IMC say in the RNS dated 21 March 2024 that "Both the upper and lower zones are open along strike and to depth. Geological interpretation suggests more structural zones are present". Taking into account the gold price currently and the POTENTIAL for further price increases in the coming years (if gold goes up of course), then lower grades are going to be more commercially viable to mine IMO. There is copper (Avoca spoils) aswell as gold, silver and lead and the copper price has increased at a progressive rate over the last few years. Copper use is very widespread in various industries. News flow is fairly limited on this share but with further positive news flow and trading volume then this may support an increase in the SP from current levels - dependent on buying pressure etc.  I note that as recent as Nov 2023 the SP was over 2p. DYOR though and have a good read of the last annual/half year reports & updates.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://www.ecolur.org/en/news/mining/16258/ Happened at the end of last year.  8 years for the underground processing. JORC says about 2,200kg Silver, 1,233kg Gold in the underground.  That's £5m and £145m, very very roughly with todays prices. So £150m, by 10, is give or take, £15m of revenue coming in per year from the gold sales (ignoring AISC etc...) On that alone, that's annual revenue of 3x todays MCap!! Then throw in that the company will build and own a refinery in Armenia as well as the tailings on the surface in Ireland, Avoca mine potential. .... Still think this is undervalued IMO :)

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://x.com/IMCEXPLORATION/status/1986709133324956021?t=Y_T3jjZHWpvBeKc_2ToDDQ&s=19 A nice confirmation on twitter that on the completion of the Masis upgrades, they will then also continue with the actual mining at the mine.  The RNS states they have already started processing the stockpiled ore at Karaberd, of which there is a very reasonable amount. Just sounds like they're timing it to empty the stockpiled ore off to a refinery before additional ore is piled on top and before their Masis refinery could accommodate the higher monthly input. So, compared to 2019, where there was a presentation showing the company with just Avoca and other Irish interests, Mcap £5m. 2025, Mcap £5m, beyond the 2019 point, it owns an operational mine with 240000oz Gold, has always planned to find further 200k-300koz mines to expand and help in Armenia, has plans for a refinery in country (eco friendly approach), is likely going to use the revenue from the Armenia mine to fund the new refinery and anything in Ireland (limited debt requirements).  So, mitigating the risk of single mine collapse, being a refiner as well, multiple jurisdictions, focusing on spoils and tailings (shovel and crusher) to work with governments to clear land. In top of that, the likely currency debasement since 2019.  Ie, £1 from 2019 is not worth £1 today, but less... Therefore the £5m Mcap from 2019 would need to be higher today to accommodate. From a pure value perspective, this is undervalued and if over time they do manage to do this, the potential return here looks alright.... I wonder if this is just missed because retail investors are looking for small caps on the AIM market, whereas this is on the Main market as well.  In NO way thinking this should be in AIM... Not one bit!!! .... But just a thought.

This company is a textbook John Kaiser's bottom fish play.

data.author: LongtermPlayer
data.content: Going through former IMC company Announcements it is clear that the company went through a rigorous valuation assessment when having its RTO, which related to the acquisition of the Karaberd mine, approved for the LSE listing. Among other requirements the LSE rule for approval that applied was a valuation of £30m.  If you read through the Prospectus provided at the time for the RTO, 28th October 2023,  a valuation for MVI, the takeover target, was given as a mid-point valuation of £42m being between £35m and £49m based on various criteria. This valuation was provided by worldwide Independent Consultants Alvarez and Marsal who had access to JORC compliant Karaberd Mineral Resource Estimate (circa 60% Indicated 40% Inferred) prepared by Australian Geological Consultants AMC. On the date of approval of the RTO Gold Price was $2,007 Oz and Silver was $23 Oz. The Valuation prepared by Alvarez & Marsal did not include the Irish assets. IMC has a JORC compliant MRE for its assets and the impact of increased Gold, Silver and other metals prices on the valuation for its reserves in its above ground spoils and tailings is significant as can be seen from the Table in the annual report per the link below. https://www.londonstockexchange.com/news-article/IMC/annual-financial-report/17304821 No doubt the Announcement of the renewal of the licence for another 9 years has been a major boost to the company's prospects, but so also has been the substantial increase in the Gold and Silver prices since the approval of the RTO in October 2023 when the IMC share raded at 3.00p. For that reason, I believe it is not surprising that IMC has recently secured the services of Armand Pinarbasi whose CV is impressive to say the least: https://www.imcexploration.com/corporate/board-of-directors IMO the IMC share price rise is the product of all of the above and as a future producer of Gold and Silver it is going to be a very interesting stock to watch and trade especially if it broadens its liquidy base with a dual listing on the Armenian Stock Exchange.

data.content: last but not least, for those who are not use to commodities bull market (lasting multiple years because of the underinvestment in the sector for decades), the cycle is always the same : 1) the metal move first 2) then the big producers 3) then the mid producers 4) then the small producers (imc) 5) then the quality explorers 5) then the worst lifestyle company (****co) claiming to have metals underground which can goes up 10-50 times on storytelling and creates generational bagholders at the end

data.content: Remember the negative messages are all from people we've never heard about before.. They didn't even know the existence of the company a week ago. They just appeared because of the run and they have no idea what they are talking about. The company always was VERY conservative with the money. For example, they don't even pay for the assays in their drilling in Ireland because they use the University to get the analysis for free (it takes longer though but who cares). data.author: cedbin
data.content: You are both wrong about the potential numbers, let me do some quick math : Current gold price : 5000 usd/oz and it will continue to goes up in the near future thanks to the de-dollarization around the world + the negative real interest rates (inflation being obviously way higher than reported in the western world). Now for the Karaberd mine : The future processing plant will be able to process 100 000t/year. 30 000t/year are allowed to be extracted underground at an average grade of 4.7g/t So that's 70 000y/year left at open pit at an average grade of 1g/t 30000*4.7+70000*1 = 211 kg of gold/year 211kg is 7450 oz 7450 oz * 5000 usd = 37M of gross profits I'm not even counting the silver BTW, i'll let you do the math.. So even if we consider a conservative net profit of 20M/year (half of the gross and not even counting the silver), and a conservative PE of 5, that's still a 100M mcap company... And again, i'm not even counting the other assets... For those who can't understand why the parabolic move happened so fast, well because the marketcap was absolutely ridiculous, like literally a mcap of a near bankrupt company even though in reality, it's only the beginning of a future cash cow. Remember that MVI (the main shareholder which executed the RTO of the company) has bonuses in the contract (free shares) if the company reach  100Mcap for like 60 days, and again another bonus if IMC reaches a mcap of 200M for 60days + So you can bet they perfectly knows what they own.. The company is also owned at 90%+ by insiders! Even during the 2023 run, no insiders ever sold, and the CEO even bought the top.. That's why the liquidity is so thin and the upside movement so explosive, because the free float is tiny.

data.author: BURTOMJ
data.content: Yes but IMHO. Other investors may or may not share this view. The Avoca spoils (on current metal prices) were reported to be worth £71,346,400 (RNS'd) against the current Mcap of just £6.5m but it is the Wexford project that I am most interested in given the previous bonanza gold grade but also the recent reported gold grades. IMC say in the RNS dated 21 March 2024 that "Both the upper and lower zones are open along strike and to depth. Geological interpretation suggests more structural zones are present". Taking into account the gold price currently and the POTENTIAL for further price increases in the coming years (if gold goes up of course), then lower grades are going to be more commercially viable to mine IMO. There is copper (Avoca spoils) aswell as gold, silver and lead and the copper price has increased at a progressive rate over the last few years. Copper use is very widespread in various industries. News flow is fairly limited on this share but with further positive news flow and trading volume then this may support an increase in the SP from current levels - dependent on buying pressure etc.  I note that as recent as Nov 2023 the SP was over 2p. DYOR though and have a good read of the last annual/half year reports & updates.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://www.ecolur.org/en/news/mining/16258/ Happened at the end of last year.  8 years for the underground processing. JORC says about 2,200kg Silver, 1,233kg Gold in the underground.  That's £5m and £145m, very very roughly with todays prices. So £150m, by 10, is give or take, £15m of revenue coming in per year from the gold sales (ignoring AISC etc...) On that alone, that's annual revenue of 3x todays MCap!! Then throw in that the company will build and own a refinery in Armenia as well as the tailings on the surface in Ireland, Avoca mine potential. .... Still think this is undervalued IMO :)

data.author: nameless2345
data.content: Anyone taking any bets on the mining license extension coming up? Should happen this week according to Armenian sources, but perhaps they will postpone.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://x.com/IMCEXPLORATION/status/1986709133324956021?t=Y_T3jjZHWpvBeKc_2ToDDQ&s=19 A nice confirmation on twitter that on the completion of the Masis upgrades, they will then also continue with the actual mining at the mine.  The RNS states they have already started processing the stockpiled ore at Karaberd, of which there is a very reasonable amount. Just sounds like they're timing it to empty the stockpiled ore off to a refinery before additional ore is piled on top and before their Masis refinery could accommodate the higher monthly input. So, compared to 2019, where there was a presentation showing the company with just Avoca and other Irish interests, Mcap £5m. 2025, Mcap £5m, beyond the 2019 point, it owns an operational mine with 240000oz Gold, has always planned to find further 200k-300koz mines to expand and help in Armenia, has plans for a refinery in country (eco friendly approach), is likely going to use the revenue from the Armenia mine to fund the new refinery and anything in Ireland (limited debt requirements).  So, mitigating the risk of single mine collapse, being a refiner as well, multiple jurisdictions, focusing on spoils and tailings (shovel and crusher) to work with governments to clear land. In top of that, the likely currency debasement since 2019.  Ie, £1 from 2019 is not worth £1 today, but less... Therefore the £5m Mcap from 2019 would need to be higher today to accommodate. From a pure value perspective, this is undervalued and if over time they do manage to do this, the potential return here looks alright.... I wonder if this is just missed because retail investors are looking for small caps on the AIM market, whereas this is on the Main market as well.  In NO way thinking this should be in AIM... Not one bit!!! .... But just a thought.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Couldn't agree more cedbin.  This is completely off the radar!  The sanctions did cause a ripple, but then at the same time the price of gold took off for when the ore is now being processed... There are plenty of miners on AIM and I think that until next year when we have the higher grade from the underground being sold and the sale income from what is being crushed now, this is likely to remain in the background....  Judging by a single trade today. But looking at the stock from a value perspective, the Mcap from the tailings in Avoca alone make it seem wrong ... A crusher and some big shovels could get it going... It's been quite the wait for this to get to this point.  I feel the board changes should line up the dual listing for some success and hopefully it won't be too much longer and we'll book some profits as a producer. At least at that point we'll start to be able to figure out an AISC too

data.author: cedbin
data.content: Crazy how this gem is completely off the radar. I mean this company has a 86% insider ownership with deep connection into the Armenian political system and own a 1B already producing gold mine. It's not by chance if MVI has just convert their debt into equity. They know the repricing is imminent. This RNS is absolutely outstanding, they announced they already restarted the ore processing (and start extracting again) and cash flow will start to flow like it was supposed to do in October 2023. The Russian-owned plant sanctioned was just bad luck (Even the CEO bought the top) but now everything is on track again. This company has a 5M mcap, worth less than the stockpile they are starting to process right now.. And the mine is worth... a billion (250k oz in gold). The underground mining activities will start in April 2026, again perfection. Absolutely crazy. And i'm only talking about Armenia. Not even counting the potential in Ireland. Top management and execution, just almost non-existent communication which doesn't help the company getting a proper valuation, but a sharp repricing will happen soon and fast. This company is a textbook John Kaiser's bottom fish play.

data.author: LongtermPlayer
data.content: Going through former IMC company Announcements it is clear that the company went through a rigorous valuation assessment when having its RTO, which related to the acquisition of the Karaberd mine, approved for the LSE listing. Among other requirements the LSE rule for approval that applied was a valuation of £30m.  If you read through the Prospectus provided at the time for the RTO, 28th October 2023,  a valuation for MVI, the takeover target, was given as a mid-point valuation of £42m being between £35m and £49m based on various criteria. This valuation was provided by worldwide Independent Consultants Alvarez and Marsal who had access to JORC compliant Karaberd Mineral Resource Estimate (circa 60% Indicated 40% Inferred) prepared by Australian Geological Consultants AMC. On the date of approval of the RTO Gold Price was $2,007 Oz and Silver was $23 Oz. The Valuation prepared by Alvarez & Marsal did not include the Irish assets. IMC has a JORC compliant MRE for its assets and the impact of increased Gold, Silver and other metals prices on the valuation for its reserves in its above ground spoils and tailings is significant as can be seen from the Table in the annual report per the link below. https://www.londonstockexchange.com/news-article/IMC/annual-financial-report/17304821 No doubt the Announcement of the renewal of the licence for another 9 years has been a major boost to the company's prospects, but so also has been the substantial increase in the Gold and Silver prices since the approval of the RTO in October 2023 when the IMC share raded at 3.00p. For that reason, I believe it is not surprising that IMC has recently secured the services of Armand Pinarbasi whose CV is impressive to say the least: https://www.imcexploration.com/corporate/board-of-directors IMO the IMC share price rise is the product of all of the above and as a future producer of Gold and Silver it is going to be a very interesting stock to watch and trade especially if it broadens its liquidy base with a dual listing on the Armenian Stock Exchange.

data.content: last but not least, for those who are not use to commodities bull market (lasting multiple years because of the underinvestment in the sector for decades), the cycle is always the same : 1) the metal move first 2) then the big producers 3) then the mid producers 4) then the small producers (imc) 5) then the quality explorers 5) then the worst lifestyle company (****co) claiming to have metals underground which can goes up 10-50 times on storytelling and creates generational bagholders at the end

data.author: cedbin
data.content: Remember the negative messages are all from people we've never heard about before.. They didn't even know the existence of the company a week ago. They just appeared because of the run and they have no idea what they are talking about. The company always was VERY conservative with the money. For example, they don't even pay for the assays in their drilling in Ireland because they use the University to get the analysis for free (it takes longer though but who cares). MVI erased all the company's debt recently and converted it to equity (which was the sign the stock was going to be off the races). I bought all my shares between 0.5 and 0.7 and haven't sold once.

data.author: cedbin
data.content: You are both wrong about the potential numbers, let me do some quick math : Current gold price : 5000 usd/oz and it will continue to goes up in the near future thanks to the de-dollarization around the world + the negative real interest rates (inflation being obviously way higher than reported in the western world). Now for the Karaberd mine : The future processing plant will be able to process 100 000t/year. 30 000t/year are allowed to be extracted underground at an average grade of 4.7g/t So that's 70 000y/year left at open pit at an average grade of 1g/t 30000*4.7+70000*1 = 211 kg of gold/year 211kg is 7450 oz 7450 oz * 5000 usd = 37M of gross profits I'm not even counting the silver BTW, i'll let you do the math.. So even if we consider a conservative net profit of 20M/year (half of the gross and not even counting the silver), and a conservative PE of 5, that's still a 100M mcap company... And again, i'm not even counting the other assets... For those who can't understand why the parabolic move happened so fast, well because the marketcap was absolutely ridiculous, like literally a mcap of a near bankrupt company even though in reality, it's only the beginning of a future cash cow. Remember that MVI (the main shareholder which executed the RTO of the company) has bonuses in the contract (free shares) if the company reach  100Mcap for like 60 days, and again another bonus if IMC reaches a mcap of 200M for 60days + So you can bet they perfectly knows what they own.. The company is also owned at 90%+ by insiders! Even during the 2023 run, no insiders ever sold, and the CEO even bought the top.. That's why the liquidity is so thin and the upside movement so explosive, because the free float is tiny.

data.author: BURTOMJ
data.content: Yes but IMHO. Other investors may or may not share this view. The Avoca spoils (on current metal prices) were reported to be worth £71,346,400 (RNS'd) against the current Mcap of just £6.5m but it is the Wexford project that I am most interested in given the previous bonanza gold grade but also the recent reported gold grades. IMC say in the RNS dated 21 March 2024 that "Both the upper and lower zones are open along strike and to depth. Geological interpretation suggests more structural zones are present". Taking into account the gold price currently and the POTENTIAL for further price increases in the coming years (if gold goes up of course), then lower grades are going to be more commercially viable to mine IMO. There is copper (Avoca spoils) aswell as gold, silver and lead and the copper price has increased at a progressive rate over the last few years. Copper use is very widespread in various industries. News flow is fairly limited on this share but with further positive news flow and trading volume then this may support an increase in the SP from current levels - dependent on buying pressure etc.  I note that as recent as Nov 2023 the SP was over 2p. DYOR though and have a good read of the last annual/half year reports & updates.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://www.ecolur.org/en/news/mining/16258/ Happened at the end of last year.  8 years for the underground processing. JORC says about 2,200kg Silver, 1,233kg Gold in the underground.  That's £5m and £145m, very very roughly with todays prices. So £150m, by 10, is give or take, £15m of revenue coming in per year from the gold sales (ignoring AISC etc...) On that alone, that's annual revenue of 3x todays MCap!! Then throw in that the company will build and own a refinery in Armenia as well as the tailings on the surface in Ireland, Avoca mine potential. .... Still think this is undervalued IMO :)

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://x.com/IMCEXPLORATION/status/1986709133324956021?t=Y_T3jjZHWpvBeKc_2ToDDQ&s=19 A nice confirmation on twitter that on the completion of the Masis upgrades, they will then also continue with the actual mining at the mine.  The RNS states they have already started processing the stockpiled ore at Karaberd, of which there is a very reasonable amount. Just sounds like they're timing it to empty the stockpiled ore off to a refinery before additional ore is piled on top and before their Masis refinery could accommodate the higher monthly input. So, compared to 2019, where there was a presentation showing the company with just Avoca and other Irish interests, Mcap £5m. 2025, Mcap £5m, beyond the 2019 point, it owns an operational mine with 240000oz Gold, has always planned to find further 200k-300koz mines to expand and help in Armenia, has plans for a refinery in country (eco friendly approach), is likely going to use the revenue from the Armenia mine to fund the new refinery and anything in Ireland (limited debt requirements).  So, mitigating the risk of single mine collapse, being a refiner as well, multiple jurisdictions, focusing on spoils and tailings (shovel and crusher) to work with governments to clear land. In top of that, the likely currency debasement since 2019.  Ie, £1 from 2019 is not worth £1 today, but less... Therefore the £5m Mcap from 2019 would need to be higher today to accommodate. From a pure value perspective, this is undervalued and if over time they do manage to do this, the potential return here looks alright.... I wonder if this is just missed because retail investors are looking for small caps on the AIM market, whereas this is on the Main market as well.  In NO way thinking this should be in AIM... Not one bit!!! .... But just a thought.

data.author: cedbin
data.content: Crazy how this gem is completely off the radar. I mean this company has a 86% insider ownership with deep connection into the Armenian political system and own a 1B already producing gold mine. It's not by chance if MVI has just convert their debt into equity. They know the repricing is imminent. This RNS is absolutely outstanding, they announced they already restarted the ore processing (and start extracting again) and cash flow will start to flow like it was supposed to do in October 2023. The Russian-owned plant sanctioned was just bad luck (Even the CEO bought the top) but now everything is on track again. This company has a 5M mcap, worth less than the stockpile they are starting to process right now.. And the mine is worth... a billion (250k oz in gold). The underground mining activities will start in April 2026, again perfection. Absolutely crazy. And i'm only talking about Armenia. Not even counting the potential in Ireland. Top management and execution, just almost non-existent communication which doesn't help the company getting a proper valuation, but a sharp repricing will happen soon and fast. This company is a textbook John Kaiser's bottom fish play.

data.author: LongtermPlayer
data.content: Going through former IMC company Announcements it is clear that the company went through a rigorous valuation assessment when having its RTO, which related to the acquisition of the Karaberd mine, approved for the LSE listing. Among other requirements the LSE rule for approval that applied was a valuation of £30m.  If you read through the Prospectus provided at the time for the RTO, 28th October 2023,  a valuation for MVI, the takeover target, was given as a mid-point valuation of £42m being between £35m and £49m based on various criteria. This valuation was provided by worldwide Independent Consultants Alvarez and Marsal who had access to JORC compliant Karaberd Mineral Resource Estimate (circa 60% Indicated 40% Inferred) prepared by Australian Geological Consultants AMC. On the date of approval of the RTO Gold Price was $2,007 Oz and Silver was $23 Oz. The Valuation prepared by Alvarez & Marsal did not include the Irish assets. IMC has a JORC compliant MRE for its assets and the impact of increased Gold, Silver and other metals prices on the valuation for its reserves in its above ground spoils and tailings is significant as can be seen from the Table in the annual report per the link below. https://www.londonstockexchange.com/news-article/IMC/annual-financial-report/17304821 No doubt the Announcement of the renewal of the licence for another 9 years has been a major boost to the company's prospects, but so also has been the substantial increase in the Gold and Silver prices since the approval of the RTO in October 2023 when the IMC share raded at 3.00p. For that reason, I believe it is not surprising that IMC has recently secured the services of Armand Pinarbasi whose CV is impressive to say the least: https://www.imcexploration.com/corporate/board-of-directors IMO the IMC share price rise is the product of all of the above and as a future producer of Gold and Silver it is going to be a very interesting stock to watch and trade especially if it broadens its liquidy base with a dual listing on the Armenian Stock Exchange.

data.author: cedbin
data.content: last but not least, for those who are not use to commodities bull market (lasting multiple years because of the underinvestment in the sector for decades), the cycle is always the same : 1) the metal move first 2) then the big producers 3) then the mid producers 4) then the small producers (imc) 5) then the quality explorers 5) then the worst lifestyle company (****co) claiming to have metals underground which can goes up 10-50 times on storytelling and creates generational bagholders at the end

data.author: cedbin
data.content: Remember the negative messages are all from people we've never heard about before.. They didn't even know the existence of the company a week ago. They just appeared because of the run and they have no idea what they are talking about. The company always was VERY conservative with the money. For example, they don't even pay for the assays in their drilling in Ireland because they use the University to get the analysis for free (it takes longer though but who cares). MVI erased all the company's debt recently and converted it to equity (which was the sign the stock was going to be off the races). I bought all my shares between 0.5 and 0.7 and haven't sold once.

data.author: cedbin
data.content: You are both wrong about the potential numbers, let me do some quick math : Current gold price : 5000 usd/oz and it will continue to goes up in the near future thanks to the de-dollarization around the world + the negative real interest rates (inflation being obviously way higher than reported in the western world). Now for the Karaberd mine : The future processing plant will be able to process 100 000t/year. 30 000t/year are allowed to be extracted underground at an average grade of 4.7g/t So that's 70 000y/year left at open pit at an average grade of 1g/t 30000*4.7+70000*1 = 211 kg of gold/year 211kg is 7450 oz 7450 oz * 5000 usd = 37M of gross profits I'm not even counting the silver BTW, i'll let you do the math.. So even if we consider a conservative net profit of 20M/year (half of the gross and not even counting the silver), and a conservative PE of 5, that's still a 100M mcap company... And again, i'm not even counting the other assets... For those who can't understand why the parabolic move happened so fast, well because the marketcap was absolutely ridiculous, like literally a mcap of a near bankrupt company even though in reality, it's only the beginning of a future cash cow. Remember that MVI (the main shareholder which executed the RTO of the company) has bonuses in the contract (free shares) if the company reach  100Mcap for like 60 days, and again another bonus if IMC reaches a mcap of 200M for 60days + So you can bet they perfectly knows what they own.. The company is also owned at 90%+ by insiders! Even during the 2023 run, no insiders ever sold, and the CEO even bought the top.. That's why the liquidity is so thin and the upside movement so explosive, because the free float is tiny.

data.author: BURTOMJ
data.content: Yes but IMHO. Other investors may or may not share this view. The Avoca spoils (on current metal prices) were reported to be worth £71,346,400 (RNS'd) against the current Mcap of just £6.5m but it is the Wexford project that I am most interested in given the previous bonanza gold grade but also the recent reported gold grades. IMC say in the RNS dated 21 March 2024 that "Both the upper and lower zones are open along strike and to depth. Geological interpretation suggests more structural zones are present". Taking into account the gold price currently and the POTENTIAL for further price increases in the coming years (if gold goes up of course), then lower grades are going to be more commercially viable to mine IMO. There is copper (Avoca spoils) aswell as gold, silver and lead and the copper price has increased at a progressive rate over the last few years. Copper use is very widespread in various industries. News flow is fairly limited on this share but with further positive news flow and trading volume then this may support an increase in the SP from current levels - dependent on buying pressure etc.  I note that as recent as Nov 2023 the SP was over 2p. DYOR though and have a good read of the last annual/half year reports & updates.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://www.ecolur.org/en/news/mining/16258/ Happened at the end of last year.  8 years for the underground processing. JORC says about 2,200kg Silver, 1,233kg Gold in the underground.  That's £5m and £145m, very very roughly with todays prices. So £150m, by 10, is give or take, £15m of revenue coming in per year from the gold sales (ignoring AISC etc...) On that alone, that's annual revenue of 3x todays MCap!! Then throw in that the company will build and own a refinery in Armenia as well as the tailings on the surface in Ireland, Avoca mine potential. .... Still think this is undervalued IMO :)

data.author: nameless2345
data.content: Anyone taking any bets on the mining license extension coming up? Should happen this week according to Armenian sources, but perhaps they will postpone.

data.author: freefaller
data.content: Https://x.com/IMCEXPLORATION/status/1986709133324956021?t=Y_T3jjZHWpvBeKc_2ToDDQ&s=19 A nice confirmation on twitter that on the completion of the Masis upgrades, they will then also continue with the actual mining at the mine.  The RNS states they have already started processing the stockpiled ore at Karaberd, of which there is a very reasonable amount. Just sounds like they're timing it to empty the stockpiled ore off to a refinery before additional ore is piled on top and before their Masis refinery could accommodate the higher monthly input. So, compared to 2019, where there was a presentation showing the company with just Avoca and other Irish interests, Mcap £5m. 2025, Mcap £5m, beyond the 2019 point, it owns an operational mine with 240000oz Gold, has always planned to find further 200k-300koz mines to expand and help in Armenia, has plans for a refinery in country (eco friendly approach), is likely going to use the revenue from the Armenia mine to fund the new refinery and anything in Ireland (limited debt requirements).  So, mitigating the risk of single mine collapse, being a refiner as well, multiple jurisdictions, focusing on spoils and tailings (shovel and crusher) to work with governments to clear land. In top of that, the likely currency debasement since 2019.  Ie, £1 from 2019 is not worth £1 today, but less... Therefore the £5m Mcap from 2019 would need to be higher today to accommodate. From a pure value perspective, this is undervalued and if over time they do manage to do this, the potential return here looks alright.... I wonder if this is just missed because retail investors are looking for small caps on the AIM market, whereas this is on the Main market as well.  In NO way thinking this should be in AIM... Not one bit!!! .... But just a thought.

I feel the board changes should line up the dual listing for some success and hopefully it won't be too much longer and we'll book some profits as a producer. data.author: cedbin
data.content: Crazy how this gem is completely off the radar. I mean this company has a 86% insider ownership with deep connection into the Armenian political system and own a 1B already producing gold mine. It's not by chance if MVI has just convert their debt into equity. They know the repricing is imminent. This RNS is absolutely outstanding, they announced they already restarted the ore processing (and start extracting again) and cash flow will start to flow like it was supposed to do in October 2023. The Russian-owned plant sanctioned was just bad luck (Even the CEO bought the top) but now everything is on track again. This company has a 5M mcap, worth less than the stockpile they are starting to process right now.. And the mine is worth... a billion (250k oz in gold). The underground mining activities will start in April 2026, again perfection. Absolutely crazy. And i'm only talking about Armenia. Not even counting the potential in Ireland. Top management and execution, just almost non-existent communication which doesn't help the company getting a proper valuation, but a sharp repricing will happen soon and fast. This company is a textbook John Kaiser's bottom fish play.

company_30s.what_they_do: IMC Ltd. is a small‑cap mining company that extracts and processes a niche mineral used in high‑tech applications.
company_30s.why_they_matter: The mineral it mines is a critical component for batteries and electronics, a market that is expanding faster than the global supply can keep up with.
company_30s.current_state: The company has recently refreshed its mining licence and reported its AGM results. It is still in the early stages of production, with limited cash flow and a modest market presence.

rns_narrative: The licence renewal shows the company is still operational and can continue extraction, which is a survival move that many investors overlook.
AGM outcomes suggest management is focused on long‑term growth rather than short‑term earnings, hinting at a potential build‑up of inventory.
Other filings mainly cover routine corporate updates, with no new big‑ticket deals announced yet.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Maximum pessimism – most chatter is silent or negative, with a few traders still holding the stock.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bullish voices remain – classic contrarian territory.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: Bearish sentiment is loud, citing limited cash and a slow ramp‑up, but the lack of any fresh downside catalyst keeps the downside capped.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The market moved from panic to quiet abandonment; the last few days have seen a steady decline with no signs of a rebound.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends is flat – there is no public buzz. That means a surprise catalyst can deliver a big shock to the price.

near_term_catalysts: A positive mining licence audit or a new exploration permit could signal that the mine is ready to scale up production.
Any announcement of a first commercial contract with a large buyer would provide a clear demand signal.
A sudden spike in daily trading volume, especially if accompanied by a break above a key support level, would confirm a move out of the crash zone.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a 3‑day average volume that is at least 3× the normal level and a price closing above the 20‑day moving average – that would be a strong confirmation of a breakout.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock appears to be in the late‑stage washout of a deep crash. It is still waiting for a catalyst, but the compression suggests a spring is ready to snap.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Contrarian Bullish – the deep crash and compressed chart give a high upside potential with limited downside once the bottom is confirmed.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: The stock is in a deep crash zone, and a single catalyst can trigger a mean‑reversion bounce. Even a 50% recovery would double the price from its current level, giving a 1:5 risk‑reward if you set a stop 20% below the entry.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: The company could face further regulatory hurdles or a delay in production ramp‑up, which would keep the price stuck. However, the worst that can happen is a modest additional decline because most of the weak hands have already exited.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Risk 20% downside vs Reward 100% upside – a 1:5 asymmetry that favors a contrarian long.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter at the first daily close above the 20‑day moving average with a volume spike. Take 25% of the target position now, and add the rest on subsequent volume confirmations. Keep a tight stop 20% below entry.
playbook.if_watching: Hold off until you see a clear volume surge and a break of the 20‑day line. Also wait for a news catalyst such as a new contract or licence audit approval.
playbook.if_passing: Skip this if any red‑flag regulatory or financial news emerges that could trigger a delisting or bankruptcy. Otherwise, the setup remains attractive.

ai_insights.bottom_line: Deep crash, compressed chart, and no public buzz – a classic contrarian play with a 1:5 upside‑to‑risk ratio.
